pr_title: Add support for Open Policy Agent authorization

timeline.bodyText: Maybe change this comment to mention OPA, what it is and a link to the docs?
timeline.author: samuel-hawker

replies.bodyText: I improved the comment. TBH I'm not sure about the doc link - we do not have them anywhere else and it sounds like something what will stop working after some time without being noticed.
replies.author: scholzj

timeline.bodyText: is "token" a leftover, OPA doesn't work with tokens, right?
timeline.author: ppatierno

replies.bodyText: The other authorizer class which was considered supported token based authentication when connecting to OPA. The one this PR uses does not support it - so I removed it but apparently forgot to remove it here. I will fix it.
replies.author: scholzj

timeline.bodyText: maybe adding more explicitly something like "allowing access even on failure"
timeline.author: ppatierno

timeline.bodyText: out of curiosity ... so the address is not just the OPA server address but a specific endpoint where the Kafka related authz policy is "exposed"?
timeline.author: ppatierno

replies.bodyText: Yes. For example in the example bove, it would query the method allow of the policy from the package kafka.authz.
replies.author: scholzj

timeline.bodyText: Maybe we could add more about the authorizer caching and this property defines the capacity, something like "Initial capacity of the OPA authorizer decision cache to avoid querying the OPA server policy endpoint every time"
timeline.author: ppatierno

timeline.bodyText: something like the previous one related to the initial capacity cache?
timeline.author: ppatierno
ppatierno

timeline.bodyText: is there a way for disabling cache? Setting max cache size to 0?
timeline.author: ppatierno

replies.bodyText: I'm not sure setting it to 0 would work. I do not think disabling the cache makes really any sense given how Apache Kafka works. The ACLs are evaluated every single time. So for example without the cache, every single fetch or produce request would mean HTTP call to OPA. So disabling the cache would criple the performance on every level. The reason for these cache options is mainly to manage the cost when the cache is growing and balance the memeory consumption.
replies.author: scholzj
